H0.text: The nervous system alerts the muscles to react when a personâ€™s arm touches something hot, causing the muscles in the arm to pull the arm away.

H1.text: Digestive is the body system that alerts the muscles to react when a person's arm touches something hot.

H2.text: The circulatory system alerts the muscles in the arm to react by pulling the arm away when a person's arm touches something hot.

H3.text: Respiratory is the body system that alerts the muscles to react when a person's arm touches something hot, causing the muscles in the arm to pull the arm away.

A4.text: The circuit begins with sensory receptors in the skin that are activated by harmful levels of heat... causing the joint angles in the arm to change, pulling the arm away.

A5.text: The PNS consists mainly of nerves... that connect the CNS to every other part of the body. Nerves that transmit signals from the brain are called motor nerves (efferent)...
